person.persName: Samuel Howard Ford (Provisional Congress of the Confederate States)

body.p: An English-born Baptist minister. Graduated from Missouri State University in 1843 and ordained a Baptist minister. Belonged to the Calvinist tradition. Married to Sallie Rochester Ford. Father of Samuel Ford. Served as minister in the Missouri cities of Jefferson City, St. Louis, and Cape Girardeau from 1844 to 1847. Served as co-editor of the Western Recorder with Dr. John L. Waller. Served as co-editor and, following Waller’s death, editor of Christian Repository. Served as minister of the Gum Spring Baptist Church in McCracken County, Kentucky of the West Union Association in 1852. Served as minister of the East Baptist Church, Long Run Baptist Church, and Floyds Fork Baptist Church in Louisville, Kentucky of the Long Run Association from 1853 to 1861. Served as a minister in Memphis, Tennessee in 1861. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Served as a minister in Mobile, Alabama from 1863 to 1865. Returned to Memphis as a minister in 1865.
